dt: {bc}a term during which a ship arriving in port and suspected of carrying contagious disease is held in isolation from the shore
{bc}a regulation placing a ship in quarantine
{bc}a place where a ship is detained during quarantine
{bc}a restraint upon the activities or communication of persons or the transport of goods designed to prevent the spread of disease or pests
{bc}a place in which those under quarantine are kept

et: partly modification of French {it}quarantaine{/it}, from Old French, from {it}quarante{/it} forty, from Latin {it}quadraginta{/it}, from {it}quadra-{/it} (akin to {it}quattuor{/it} four) + {it}-ginta{/it} (akin to vi{it}ginti{/it} twenty); partly modification of Italian {it}quarantena{/it} quarantine of a ship, from {it}quaranta{/it} forty, from Latin {it}quadraginta{/it} {ma}{mat|four|}, {mat|vigesimal|}{/ma}
shortdef: a term during which a ship arriving in port and suspected of carrying contagious disease is held in isolation from the shore
a regulation placing a ship in quarantine

dt: {bc}to detain in or exclude by quarantine
{bc}to isolate from normal relations or communication

shortdef: to detain in or exclude by quarantine
to isolate from normal relations or communication
to establish or declare a quarantine

dt: {bc}to refrain from any contact with other individuals for a period of time (such as two weeks) during the outbreak of a contagious disease usually by remaining in one's home and limiting contact with family members

To reduce transmission of a contagious disease during an outbreak, individuals are typically asked by health officials to self-quarantine following known contact with an infectious person or after returning from a region where cases of the disease are widely reported.

dt.t: As the coronavirus spreads across the country, thousands of people who may have been exposed to the virus through travel abroad or contact with an infected person have been asked to {wi}self-quarantine{/wi} for two weeks to help contain the outbreak.

Senator Ted Cruz (R-TX) announced on Sunday evening that he will be {wi}self-quarantining{/wi} at home in Texas after learning that he had a {ldquo}brief conversation and a handshake{rdquo} with someone at the Conservative Political Action Conference who later tested positive for the coronavirus.

utxt.t: [Sam] Page said the woman's father did not comply with the health department's instructions and left {wi}self-quarantine{/wi} to take another daughter to a school function on Saturday.
{wi}Self-quarantines{/wi} only work if people are willing to inconvenience themselves for the public good.

shortdef: to refrain from any contact with other individuals for a period of time (such as two weeks) during the outbreak of a contagious disease usually by remaining in one's home and limiting contact with family members
